alert.note: Alert for Charleston (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Charleston (the Southern end of South Carolina and Eastern Georgia)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 19 at 7:16PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southeast South Carolina, including the following county, Charleston. * WHEN...Until 800 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 715 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated showers and thunderstorms with torrential rainfall over Mount Pleasant, Isle of Palms and Sullivans Island. This line will build slowly south and southwest through 8 PM. - Additional rainfall of 1 to 1.5 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Mount Pleasant, Isle Of Palms, Sullivan`s Island, Sullivans Island, Fort Moultrie, The Old Village, Remleys Point, Wild Dunes, Mount Pleasant Waterfront Park, Patriots Point and Ravenel Bridge.
info.instruction: Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
